item.title: 米国で1月29日から加入者向けのダウングレードとして始まったアマゾンのプライム・ビデオのベーシック広告ティアは、ドルビービジョンHDRとドルビーアトモスサウンドのサポートを静かにカットした（John Archer/Forbes）
item.description:
John Archer / Forbes:
Amazon's Prime Video basic ad tier, which began on Jan. 29 in the US as a downgrade to subscribers, quietly cut Dolby Vision HDR and Dolby Atmos sound support  —  Amazon AMZN caused a furor recently when it announced that it was introducing advertisements right across its Prime Video streaming service.

item.title: ジョン・スチュワートとレイチェル・マドウが月曜出演でトークTVを盛り上げるテストに注目；Vivvix：デイリー・ショーの2022年の広告売上は$39.9Mに対し、2014年は$129.1Mだった（Brian Steinberg/Variety）
item.description:
Brian Steinberg / Variety:
A look at Jon Stewart and Rachel Maddow's test to boost talk TV via Monday appearances; Vivvix: Daily Show had $39.9M in ad sales in 2022 vs. $129.1M in 2014  —  Can Mondays do for the TV business what Thursdays and Sundays once did?  Some of the medium's best-known personalities are trying to figure this question out.

item.title: ファンダム、新ジェネレーティブAI機能「Quick Answers」でファンの質問に不正確な回答をし、ファンWikiクリエイターからの批判に直面（Emilia David/The Verge）
item.description:
Emilia David / The Verge:
Fandom faces criticism from fan Wiki creators after its new generative AI feature Quick Answers gives inaccurate answers to fan questions  —  Fandom, which hosts wikis for many fandoms, will roll out generative AI features that it previously tested but now promises users will be able to opt out.

item.title: Xは、今月末から広告主がクリエイターの動画の前に広告を掲載できるようにする計画で、収益分配を提供するとしているが、詳細は明らかにしていない（Bloomberg）。
item.description:
Bloomberg:
X plans to let advertisers run ads before creators' videos starting later this month, and says it will offer a revenue split but doesn't disclose any details  —  Elon Musk's X is adding new advertiser targeting features to better entice video creators and compete against YouTube.

item.title: 404 Mediaの共同設立者4人へのインタビュー。彼らはそれぞれテック系ニュースの25％を所有しており、立ち上げから半年で黒字になったという（Hanaa' Tameez/Nieman Lab）。
item.description:
Hanaa' Tameez / Nieman Lab:
Interviews with the four co-founders of 404 Media, who each own 25% of the tech news outlet, which they say is profitable six months after launch  —  “Owning our own work, and being beholden to no one but our readers and colleagues — as opposed to say, investors, venture capitalists …

item.title: Meta、米Threadsで "今日の話題 "のテストを開始、アプリ内の検索ページやFor Youフィードに表示、政治的な内容を取り上げることも（Sarah Perez/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Sarah Perez / TechCrunch:
Meta begins testing “today's topics” on Threads in the US, surfaced in the app on the Search page and in the For You feed, that can feature political content  —  After acknowledging last week that Meta's X competitor Threads would not actively recommend political content …

item.title: NPR「モーニング・エディション」の司会を24年間務めたベテラン放送作家、ボブ・エドワーズが76歳で死去（Lynn Neary/NPR）
item.description:
Lynn Neary / NPR:
Bob Edwards, the veteran broadcaster who hosted NPR's Morning Edition for 24 years, dies at 76  —  Bob Edwards, the veteran broadcaster and longtime host of Morning Edition who left an indelible mark on NPR's sound, has died.  He was 76 years old.  —  NPR's Susan Stamberg …

item.title: スレート社によると、2023年は27年の歴史の中で最も収益性の高い年であり、投資とポッドキャストとウェブサイトの成長により、収益は前年比28％増となった（Max Tani/Semafor）
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Slate says 2023 was the most profitable year in its 27 year history, with revenue up 28% YoY through investments and growth in its podcasts and website  —  The Scoop  —  Amid a difficult year for news media last year, at least one legacy digital media company has quietly been moving the other direction.

item.title: ガーディアンは、12月31日までの9ヶ月間で広告収入が16％（900万ポンド）減少し、会員収入が予算を300万ポンド下回るため、2023/24年度には3900万ポンドの赤字になると予測している（Bron Maher/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
Guardian forecasts a £39M deficit in FY 2023/24 as ad revenue was down 16%, or £9M, in the nine months to Dec. 31 and membership revenue was £3M behind budget  —  Digital reader revenue came in 4% below expectations.  —  Advertising revenue at Guardian News and Media was down £9m …

item.title: 前払い式エネルギー・メーターに関する調査の一環として、ブリティッシュ・ガスの債権回収業者に潜入した『タイムズ』紙のポール・モーガン＝ベントリーへのインタビュー（Clara Aberneithie/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Clara Aberneithie / Press Gazette:
An interview with The Times' Paul Morgan-Bentley on going undercover with British Gas debt collectors as part of an investigation into pre-payment energy meters  —  Getting something “badly wrong” is what keeps head of investigations Morgan-Bentley up at night.

item.title: ジェネレーティブAIはいかに広告業界を変革するか：WPPとピュブリシスは、AIをビジネスに組み込むために数億ドルを費やす計画だ（ダニエル・トーマス／フィナンシャル・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
Daniel Thomas / Financial Times:
How generative AI is transforming the advertising industry; WPP and Publicis plan to spend hundreds of millions of dollars to embed AI in their businesses  —  At the start of the year, every single one of the roughly 100,000 people working for advertising giant Publicis received a video message …

item.title: 英国の放送テレビ市場の変化、同局の番組予算の削減、ストリーミングへの段階的な移行について、チャンネル4のアレックス・マホンCEOにインタビュー（Mark Sweney/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Mark Sweney / The Guardian:
An interview with Channel 4 CEO Alex Mahon on changes in the UK's broadcast TV market, cuts to the network's program budget, and a gradual shift to streaming  —  The network boss believes production companies that underpin Britain's global reputation face being forced out of business

item.title: マレーシア、英国人反汚職記者クレア・リューキャッスル・ブラウンに、1MDB報道をめぐる名誉棄損の罪で欠席禁固2年の判決（ジャーナリスト保護委員会）

Committee to Protect Journalists:
Malaysia sentences British anti-corruption reporter Clare Rewcastle Brown to two years in prison in absentia for criminal defamation over her 1MDB reporting  —  The Committee to Protect Journalists calls on Malaysian authorities to reverse the decision to sentence British anti-corruption …

item.description:
Daniel Thomas / Financial Times:
A look at the uncertain future of TalkTV as its star presenter Piers Morgan moves to YouTube, saying his daily show had become an “unnecessary straitjacket”  —  Outspoken presenter is moving his ‘Uncensored’ show from TalkTV to YouTube  —  Piers Morgan, the outspoken presenter …

item.title: 100以上のFASTチャンネルを持つシンクレアが2019年に立ち上げ、2024年1月にシンキング・メディアに売却されたSTIRRが、国際展開を計画している様子（Lauren Forristal/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Lauren Forristal / TechCrunch:
A look at STIRR, launched in 2019 by Sinclair with 100+ FAST channels and sold to Thinking Media in January 2024, as it plans an international expansion  —  Broadcasting company Sinclair recently sold off its free, ad-supported streaming TV (FAST) service STIRR to Thinking Media …
